headline: Greek Lentil Soup (Fakes)
description: Greek lentil soup or fakes is an easy, nutritious soup with brown lentils and vegetables seasoned with herbs and garnished with olive oil and vinegar.

video.description: See how to make traditional Greek lentil soup.
video.name: Greek Lentil Soup

name: Greek Lentil Soup (Fakes)
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 teaspoon olive oil, or to taste
1 teaspoon red wine vinegar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place lentils in a large saucepan; add enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring water to a boil and cook for 10 minutes; drain.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, and garlic; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour in lentils, then add 1 quart water, bay leaves, oregano, and rosemary. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low; simmer for 10 minutes.

Stir in tomato paste; season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until lentils have softened, 30 to 40 minutes. Add additional water if soup becomes too thick. Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar to serve.

review.reviewBody: I liked this a lot and am making it for the second time this week.
This is a really good Mediterranean Lentil Soup just like my Italian Nona made. Added some baby spinach for extra vegetables. Delicious.
I make this so often, I finally have it memorized! I don’t add vinegar at the end (my mother does!) but I do top it with feta crumbles. Also love it with a piece of paximadi (Greek barley rusk).
Gorgeous, nutritious warming meal. I like to serve with homemade focaccia. I don't pre cook the lentils, I wash and leave to soak for half hour or so in cold water 😋
Delicious. Of course we tweaked it a little. For the first tie ever we used a little stuffing seasoning and it was terrific. We also used chicken broth instead of water.

I cannot rate this highly enough, the flavour that comes out of so few ingredients is incredible! I personally double the amount of tomato paste, garlic and all the herbs but it’s not necessary I just prefer it that way. I also add a crumbling of feta or goats cheese on top with the drizzle of olive oil and salt and pepper. I didn’t have red wine vinegar so I used balsamic and it’s amazing! Since finding this recipe we eat it twice a month. Thank you so much for such a beautifully authentic recipe! X

I loved the recipe. It was simple yet subtly delicious. I did not have rosemary so I substituted fresh thyme, along with the oregano, tomato paste ,and plenty of salt and pepper. I even enjoyed it without the vinegar!

Great recipe. Never learned it from my Yiayia. I don’t think she used tomato paste but thought I’d give it a try. Our family always adds apple cider vinegar instead of red wine vinegar. It’s delicious!
Love the flavor!! My mother made something similar .

I used red lentils because that's what I had on hand. I added celery, and reduced the amount of oil. I know olive oil is healthful, but I am having some digestive issues right now where I can only handle small amounts of any fats. It still tastes great with less oil, so I think people should use this recipe as a starting point and adjust to their personal dietary needs. Thank you for this idea.
Instead of water, I used vegetable stock. I also added a whole can of tomato paste. Made a wonderful soup. The vinegar at the end truly gives the soup a bigger flavor!! Definitely a meal in itself!

This soup is very tasty. I used red lentils because I didn't have brown and for the red wine vinegar I substituted 1 tsp apple cider vinegar and 1 tsp red cooking wine. I also used vegetable broth instead of water and added carrots, spinach, and cayenne. With some crusty bread it was very yummy and filling. I'll definitely be making this again.
This was so delicious!!
GOOD

I love this recipe. I come back to it at regular intervals because it is delicious, warm and comforting. The vinegar gives it an extra kick - doesn't really make it sour, just ups the flavour like salt might. Don't skip it.

5 Star Recipe!! This was SO GOOD! I did make a few changes which I think made it even more flavorful. I used some cumin and substituted half the water for vegetable stalk...delicious !! Used the whole box of veggie stalk and could have probably used more. All in all can't wait to have this for the next few days and can't wait to make again! YUM!
Five stars because it is easy to make, nutritious and delicious. I doubled the recipe because everyone always wants more. Thank you for sharing.

Just like Yia Yia used to make! As with most Greek dishes, change ingredients and proportions to taste and availability of ingredients. I prefer mine topped with a hefty pour of balsamic vinegar. The vinegar is what brings out all the flavors in the dish. I could eat this everyday and now that I know how to cook it, I just might!
This is really good, and simple too! We are not vegetarian, so next time I will substitute stock for the water, and add some meat - maybe some ham.

Super simple recipe. Made it for my family; they only ever experienced the Arabic restaurant’s kind. This is their new favorite and they love that it’s part of my culture. Great recipe. Red wine vinegar is imperative but lemon will do in a pinch.
We loved this. The red wine vinegar threw me off a bit, but oh my, how wonderful it is!
Great recipe. Easy & Delicious perfect for me. Its my goto now my son loves it too. TYVM!!
I added chicken broth instead of water. I omitted the tomato paste. Very tasty.

Made this exactly as written ... except for forgetting to stir while simmering and trying to burn it. Despite that, this was so good. The red vinegar and olive oil at the end really complete this dish. I will definitely make this, and variations of this dish many more times! Thank you for sharing this simple, healthy, delicious meal!

My family loved this meal. Even my son who doesn’t like soup very much. I did add celery and chicken broth to the recipe. 
Definitely a keeper!
Perfect! Easy to make and tastes amazing!

I love this recipe! I’ve recently stopped eating meat and have been searching for hearty vegetarian soups with protein. I omitted the Rosemary, but followed the rest of the recipe as written. I was skeptical about adding vinegar, but was pleasantly surprised when I tried it! Thank you for sharing your recipe!
I make this recipe all the time. It’s very good exactly as written. The red wine vinegar gives it an added dimension that pushes this soup to another level. Forever a favorite of mine.

This is a perfect recipe. My family loves it and I make it often. It is hearty, smile, flavorful, warming. I’m South Indian and our cuisine has much in common with the Greek diet, but this is a healthier twist on “dal” (what we call lentils, prepared many ways) with olive oil. I like the very simple seasonings - a break from overly seasoned stuff. I love the depth vinegar brings! I’d love to try this with high quality oil and vinegar, but I just use grocery store stuff.

I have tried so many different lentil soup recipes, but just didn't love any of them until I found this one! The only thing I didn't do was to add the tomato paste because I didn't have any. It's really good either way, but definitely add the red wine vinegar.
This is just simply DELICIOUS. And I don’t even like lentils that much. The red wine vinegar transforms it A must!

I love this soup and am basing my review on it as written. After having made it several times I do use vegetable or chicken broth in place of water. I love simple food. This soup is simple and cozy, which is a beautiful combination. Don't skip the vinegar.
LOVE this recipe. Easy and delicious. Full of protein and fiber. A real hit for my home. Thank you!

It was amazing. Followed the recipe exactly except used vegetable broth instead of water. The vinegar at the end is amazing. It may sound strange to do that but trust me, it is awesome! Thank you for this recipe!
Our family LOVES this soup! Make it just as written. The key is adding the vinegar and olive oil to each bowl after serving. Each person can adjust to taste. So simple and so delicious.
Had very little flavor! I had to add more salt & hot sauce.
I added a potato, chopped fine, to the sauteed veggies, and left out the oregano and rosemary.

Used instant pot. After precooking lentils for 10 minutes I sautéed veggies. Pressure cooked on high for 4 minutes after adding lentils and water and then another 8 minutes after adding tomato paste. There was not a drop left of the soup. My family of four ate it all!

Oh my goodness this was delicious!! I wasn’t sure I’d like it, as I’ve never had lentils before, but I got some in my grocery order and the reviews for this soup were so good I decided to try. It was delicious! The olive oil and vinegar really make it! I subbed chicken broth for the water and used balsamic vinegar. I will definitely make this again.
Love love this recipe! So simple and easy to put together yet delicious and healthy! Thanks so much!
Absolutely delicious, and super easy
Made it today exactly to the recipe, and I must say, while it is good, it is bland compared to my other variations with additional veggies and sausages/bacon etc.
I’ve made this loads of times and love it with the vinegar!

My husband doesn’t like the texture of onions, so I substituted onion powder. I also used broth instead of plain water. I cooked it in the Instant pot for 8 minutes and NPR. It turned out great! So easy and delicious.

I actually got a similar recipe for this from my mother in law who is Italian - 38 years ago. Never realized it was a Greek dish. I also add chicken stock instead of water. I cut up pieces of ham as well, usually when I get a ham steak. Yummy with grilled cheese sandwiches on a rainy night!

This simple, quick soup has incredible flavor and is so easy to make. I have made it 4 times now and have been asked for the recipe twice. The first three times I followed the recipe exactly with just one exception and loved it. The one exception was olive oil - my personal preference was to use 1 Tbsp total. Last night when I made it I quadrupled the existing spices, added a teaspoon of smoked paprika and served it with lemon wedges to squeeze in to taste. Thank you so much for sharing, this is now one of our favorite soups!!

This soup has become a regular in my house. I love soup and even find ways to cook it in the summertime. This works great if you have a busy day planned, sauté onions garlic and carrots then throw everything into a crockpot. The first time I made this soup I tasted it and thought it was okay, then added the vinegar and tasted it again, what a difference the vinegar makes. Do not leave it out! Thank you for this amazing recipe!
Delicious. Served with baguette.
Very bland.

Only changes: shallots instead of onion (working with what is in the pantry), white balsamic vinegar instead of red wine vinegar. Very tasty! Kept one serving for my lunch and gave the rest to neighbours. Will make this again.
Loved the flavors and easy to make!

I couldn’t believe how much that little bit of red wine vinegar changed the taste of this recipe! I added probably 2 tsp totally. It gave it such a crisp and almost buttery flavor. This was an easy quarantine pantry soup to make. Will make again!
NO changes; will make it again.

A very easy, tasty recipe. I love all the ingredients but if I choose to shake things up, I can swap out herbs and spices to give it my personal flavor. The vinegar? Oh my goodness YES! What a delightful flavor it brings.
Delicious! We make it at least once a month!

This is absolutely my new favorite soup!! I actually doubled the recipe. It was so easy to prepare. I think the combination drizzle of olive oil and red wine vinegar on top really nailed it for me. I haven't had that particular combination before. It was awesome!! Thanks to whoever submitted the recipe. I'll keep it forever!!

I've made this a couple of time straight from the recipe and while it was okay, it just wasn't wonderful. This time instead of a quart of water, I used 2 cups water, 1 cup of chicken broth and a cup of red wine. Instead of 1 tbsp tomato paste, I used a quarter cup of ketchup and I added a dash of hot sauce. 

So now it's not Fakes, but it does have a more robust flavor. 

Do add the recommended olive oil and vinegar on top when served. That helps a lot.
I was so scared about cooking this recipe. I should not have been! Turned out great!

I used chicken broth in the step with the vegetables, to replace the water,, as well as three carrots and garlic powder in addition to minced garlic. 
Omitted the tomato paste and replaced with can diced tomatoes, added extra oregano. When finished cooking I added two tablespoons of red wine vinegar and sliced kalamata olives, then feta and sour cream in each serving.

Lentil soup is my favorite “comfort food,” and this recipe is the one I always return to. I follow exactly as instructed and agree that the vinegar is an integral ingredient. Good quality olive oil makes a difference, too. Add some warm pita or a crusty baguette to dip for a perfect meal.
Needs more salt

Oh my goodness! I’m on day FIVE of eating this for lunch & it is delicious!! It’s rare that I don’t change a recipe, but literally changed nothing with this! All I had was Balsalmic vinegar, which has been delicious. I did take half of the finished product & blend it in my vitamix—it turned into a creamy texture my kid’s would actually eat. And low & behold after much nose-sniffing & tongue-sticking, 2/3 kids admitted it was yummy as well! Served initially with sourdough bread, I’ve eaten it plain for every meal following. Definitely making again!
I grew up eating this soup. This is my go-to recipe whenever I crave this healthy, protein-rich soup. Excellent! Thank you for sharing!

An excellent, versatile recipe. 

I'm really responding in support of the author's comments in response to some critics. I want to be very clear that while I followed the outlines of this recipe, I used what I had on hand.

I was out of bay leaves, but I added mint. 

I added 4 potatoes, cut in small chunks. 

I added chicken stock.

I tasted it to adjust seasoning, and then added a healthy glug of white wine vinegar. 

It was excellent. Even my lentil-hating kid liked it.

I didn't have any bay leaves so I had to leave them out. Before adding the red wine vinegar it was at best a 3 star recipe flavor wise. Adding the vinegar definitely kicked the flavor up a notch. IF you try it without the vinegar and don't like it then I'd encourage you to try it again with the vinegar.
I made it true to the recipe and we loved it. We will have it again and again.

I loved this recipe. Part of the appeal of lentils is how hearty and earthy they are. They are simple and satisfying. This recipe allows them to shine by complementing the lentil's natural flavor without overpowering it. I used dried basil instead of rosemary, as I personally don't prefer rosemary, but otherwise followed this to a T. It's my new go-to when I want something hot and delicious that doesn't take a lot of effort.
Excellent recipe, very tasty. I added a bit of Italian seasoning in addition and used chicken broth.. the tomato paste and red wine vinegar add depth. A little extra carrot as well, will make again.

This recipe is fantastic! We often reach for this soup when we are fasting before the holidays (no animal derived products/vegan diet). I omit the rosemary (personal preference) and double the oregano instead. I also sometimes add crushed red pepper and stir the red wine vinegar right into the pot at the very end. Otherwise, I follow the ingredients, their quantities and the instructions to a T! Thank you for this wonderful and comforting recipe!
This soup was just ok....easy recipe! Maybe I don't like lentils?

I’ve made this over & over. Absolutely delicious, healthy, and inexpensive to prepare. I added more tomato paste (almost the entire small can). I do not like vinegar, but don’t skip this! It enhances the flavor beautifully.

This was just as I remembered my mother and grandmothers fakes, thank you! I used mainly chicken broth (1.5 qts) and 2 cups of water. Didn't make any other substitutions. My mother rotated between adding celery, potatoes, and/or carrots. Whatever she had on hand. Doubled the recipe to have lots of leftovers!

We used way more tomato paste than recommended (the whole can) and added more oregano, plus sage and onion powder. Also instead of just water we did half water, half chicken broth. We loved it and our picky friend (who "hates lentil soup") liked it enough to ask to take some leftovers home! I'm sure we made it less authentic with our changes... but it was a good soup!
So delicious! Easy to follow recipe. I added cheese on top and it was to die for. Don't be afraid of pepper either!!
I made this for my six-year-old son and he loved it! Add some extra lemon. Will definitely make again!
Funny story. Recipe works even if you accidentally use split peas instead of lentils (plus some extra cook time).

I love this so much!!! I'm on the Mediterranean diet and this is my go-to food. I have two bowls in the freezer right now. I do add some better-than-boullion to jazz it up and some salt. I usually don't add the vinegar. . I don't know why, I just prefer it without. Yum Yum Yummo. I could eat it every day.
I made this and it came out amazing, super healthy and I’m a pescatarian. Loved this recipe and it’s my go to meal whenever I’m undecided on what to cook !
I made this and it came out amazing, super healthy and I’m a pescatarian. Loved this recipe and it’s my go to meal whenever I’m undecided on what to cook !
Perfect! I didn't add the onion but it turned out great. I ate it with naan.

I found it relatively flavourless, actually, even after adding the red wine vinegar. I think if you used beef broth instead of water it would take it up a level! Will be doing that next time. 

Added double the carrots and a zucchini, too, which added a nice amount of texture! :)
I followed the recipe as is, but I think I may have been heavy handed with the rosemary. It was a very easy and tasty recipe. Next time, I'll go easy on the rosemary.
Great base recipe. Added a few things like celery and some red wine, red pepper flake to get the right flavor.

This was absolutely delicious! Thank you so much for this recipe. The little differences I made was increase the quantity of oregano and rosemary and also added thyme. I made for my vegetarian days of week so I added a bunch of raw spinach in the bowl before pouring hot soup so that the spinach would wilt a little. Drizzled some olive oil and red wine vinegar and served with a whole wheat toasted topped with baba ganoush from this website. So yummy!!!

I fell in love with Fakes when I was staying with a host family in Greece for 2 months. When I came back home to Canada I tried to find a recipe everywhere and this one comes the closest to the one my host mom used to make. It's so delicious, hearty and easy to make!
Its possible that i mismeasured something, but it was pretty bland. Next time I'll probably use some broth in placd for the water
Tastes amazing but I think I overcooked the lentils - they broke down. I added hot sauce bc spicy is my weakness but I would double the seasonings if I make this again.

Daughter has recently gone vegetarian so looking for easy recipes like this where I can take part of it and add meat for those that choose that. This recipe was a good, simple meal. I made a double recipe and added sausage to half and left half vegetarian.

I make this often! I’ve gotten so many compliments on it. It’s a good basic lentil soup recipe. I’ve always used whatever vinegar I have on hand and when it’s all done we use garlic salt to taste! This with a fresh loaf of bread (made in the bread maker) is a great healthy meal!
Filling and Don't forget the balsamic vinegar, adds a flavor to the base.
This is the best lentil recipe I have ever made. What a perfect tasting soup!
love this dish... i add a bit of vinegar/ xidi ? Thanks for the recipe.

Simple to make. Taste is very good and don't forget the vinegar on your serving.
Thank you for submitting this recipe.
I chose this recipe because it was the closest to my grandmothers. I have a food sensitivity to garlic, so I left it out, but other than that I followed the recipe exactly.
Delicious! I added cubed winter squash, just because I have so many from the garden to use up, and used fresh herbs not dried.
Needed a little extra salt but very good!
I made this Two times now. I used this recipe exactly as written and it is wonderful. The best I have ever eaten. My wife also loves it as is. Will become a staple for us.
We enjoyed this one. Mine turned out a little more reddish because I put extra tomato paste. We had steamed broccoli with it and we all ended up putting it in our lentils and liked it.
The leftovers of this soup were much tastier than the night I cooked it. I think next time I'll serve it the day after I cook it to let the flavors blend.
